Subjective: Left ear pain x3 days. Feels filled with water. Worse after showering. Hearing also affected. Negatives: No fever, no systemic symptoms. Social: Recently started swimming (ear gets wet often), cleans ears with cotton buds 3x/week. ICE: Wants pain to stop, slightly worried.
Objective: Temp 36.2 C (no fever). Right ear: normal, eardrum intact. Left ear: painful when pulled, red/inflamed, ear canal swollen and thickened, eardrum not well visualized.
Assessment: Left ear canal inflammation (otitis externa), likely due to frequent wetting and cotton bud use.
Plan: 1. Paracetamol up to 4000mg daily as needed for pain. 2. Anti-inflammatory/acidic ear drops, 3x daily for 1 week. 3. Avoid cleaning with cotton buds. 4. Keep ear dry for 1 week. 5. Follow-up in 1 week.
